  • dtype (_type_, optional) – _description_. Defaults to float.

  • format (_type_, optional) – _description_. Defaults to None.

  • type (str, optional) – _description_. Defaults to ‘FD’.

Raises:

  • ValueError – _description_

  • NotImplementedError – _description_

Returns:

fcdft.solvent.esp module#

fcdft.solvent.esp.ang2bohr = 1.8897261245650618#

The values in ‘options’ (in esp_atomic_charges) are set to reproduce the NWCHEM ESP calculation. — <input>—

charge 0 geometry units angstroms noautosym noautoz nocenter

O 0.00000 -0.07579 0.0000 H 0.86681 0.60144 0.0000 H -0.86681 0.60144 0.0000

end

basis spherical

  • library “aug-cc-pvdz”

end

scf

thresh 1e-8 print low

end

task scf energy

esp

recalculate restrain hfree

end

task esp —<end input>—–

— (output: RHF/aug-cc-pvdz)–

Atom Coordinates Charge

ESP RESP RESP2

constr

1 O 0.000000 -0.007579 0.000000 -0.673531 -0.672911 -0.672911 2 H 0.086681 0.060144 0.000000 0.333545 0.333230 0.333230 3 H -0.086681 0.060144 0.000000 0.339986 0.339681 0.339681

—-(end output)———-

fcdft.solvent.esp.esp_atomic_charges(mol, dm, options_dict={}, verbose=0, gpu_accel=False)#

Estimate (R)ESP atomic charges

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf.gto.Mole())

  • dm (density matrix)

  • options_dict{} (dict, optional) – dictionary of user’s defined options

  • verbose (0, optional)

Returns:

charges

Return type:

list

fcdft.solvent.esp.esp_esp(mol, dm, coords, gpu_accel=False)#

Estimate the electrostatic potential (ESP) at each grid point and atomic site as the second step.

Parameters:

  • pyscf.Mole() (mol =)

  • Matrix (dm = density)

  • (ngrid (coords = np.array)

  • 3) (grid point)

Returns:

Vnuc - Vele

Return type:

np.array : the ESP value at each grid

fcdft.solvent.esp.esp_fit(mol, grids, grids_val, restraint, hfree, resp_a, resp_b, maxiter, tolerance, verbose)#
Fitting procedure for (R)ESP atomic charges

In case of RESP, a penalty function is a hyperbolic form: penalty funciton = resp_a sum_i (q_i*q_i - resp_b*resp_b)**0.5 - resp_b)

Parameters:#

mol : pyscf.Mole() grids : np.array (ngrid, 3), grid coordinates grids_val : np.array (ngrid), the V at grid point restraint : bool

whether restraint included

hfreebool

whether hydrogen atoms excluded or included in restraint

resp_afloat

restraint scale

resp_bfloat

restraint parabola tightness

maxiterint

maximum number of interactions

tolerancefloat,

tolerance for charges in the fitting

verboseint

print out message

Returns: qf : list

(R)ESP atomic charges

fcdft.solvent.esp.esp_grid(mol, rcut=3.0, ngrids=49, probe=0.7)#

Generate grid points as the first step. This function was modified for better performance.

Parameters:

  • mol (gto.Mole() : provides the coordinates and atomic numbers.)

  • rcut (float) – A cut-off distance in A for the solvent accessible region around the molecule

  • ngrids (integer) – The number of grid points along each axis

  • probe (float) – A radius in A determining the envolope around the molecule

Returns:

grids

Return type:

np.array (float)

fcdft.solvent.esp.get_esp_radii(probe)#

Parameters:

get_rho_ions(phi_tot=None, cb=None, lambda_r=None, T=None)#

Size-modified ion charge density.

Parameters:

  • solvent_obj (PBE) – Solvent object

  • phi_tot (1D numpy.ndarray, optional) – Total electrostatic potential. Defaults to None.

  • cb (float, optional) – Ion concentration in atomic unit. Defaults to None.

  • lambda_r (1D numpy.ndarray, optional) – Ion-exclusion function. Defaults to None.

  • T (float, optional) – Temperature. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Ion charge density

Return type:

1D numpy.ndarray

make_eps(coords, eps_sam, eps, stern_sam, delta1, sas)#

Calculates the dielectric function.

Parameters:

  • coords (2D numpy.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinates

  • eps_sam (float) – Dielectric constant of the self-assembled monolayer

  • eps (float) – Dielectric constant of the bulk solvent.

  • stern_sam (float) – Stern layer length of the self-assembled monolayer in atomic unit.

  • delta1 (float) – Broadening constant of error functions.

  • sas (1D numpy.ndarray) – Solvent-accessible surface.

Returns:

Dielectric function

Return type:

1D numpy.ndarray

make_grad_eps(mol, coords, eps_sam, eps, probe, stern_sam, delta1, delta2, atomic_radii, sas)#

Generates analytic gradient of the dielectric function.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf.gto.Mole) – Mole object.

  • coords (2D numpy.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinates.

  • eps_sam (float) – Dielectric constant of the self-assembled monolayer.

  • eps (float) – Dielectric constant of the bulk solvent.

  • probe (float) – Probe radius.

  • stern_sam (float) – Thickness of the Stern layer formed by the self-assembled monolayer.

  • delta1 (float) – Width of error function along z-axis.

  • delta2 (float) – Width of error function used for molecular part.

  • atomic_radii (1D numpy.ndarray) – Atomic radii.

  • sas (1D numpy.ndarray) – Solvent-accessible surface.

Returns:

Gradient of the dielectric function.

Return type:

2D numpy.ndarray

make_lambda(mol, probe, stern_mol, stern_sam, coords, delta1, delta2, atomic_radii)#

Ion-exclusion function.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf.gto.Mole) – Mole object.

  • probe (float) – Probe radius in a.u..

  • stern_mol (float) – Molecular Stern layer thickness in a.u..

  • stern_sam (float) – SAM Stern layer thickness in a.u..

  • coords (2D numpy.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinates.

  • delta1 (float) – Broadening constant in error functions used for the molecular part.

  • delta2 (float) – Broadening constant in error functions used for the SAM part.

  • atomic_radii (1D numpy.ndarray) – Atomic radii

Returns:

Ion-exclusion function

Return type:

1D array

  • delta2 (float) – broadening constant in a.u..

nuc_grad_method(grad_method)#

For grad_method in vacuum, add nuclear gradients of solvent

reset(mol=None)#

Reset mol and clean up relevant attributes for scanner mode

to_gpu()#

Convert a method to its corresponding GPU variant, and recursively converts all attributes of a method to cupy objects or gpu4pyscf objects.

fcdft.solvent.pbe.bc_grad(solvent_obj, ngrids, spacing, T, slope, phi_z, sas)#

Analytic gradient of the boundary conditions.

Parameters:

  • solvent_obj (PBE) – Solvent object.

  • ngrids (int) – Number of grid points along each axis.

  • spacing (float) – Grid spacing.

  • T (float) – Temperature.

  • slope (float) – Negative of electric field inside the Stern layer.

  • phi_z (1D numpy.ndarray) – Boundary value before applying the solvent-accessible surface.

  • sas (1D numpy.ndarray) – Solvent-accessible surface.

Returns:

Analytic gradient of the boundary values, analytic gradient of the electrostatic potential before applying solvent-accessible surface, and analytic gradient of the solvent-accessible surface.

Return type:

2D numpy.ndarray, 2D numpy.ndarray, 2D numpy.ndarray

fcdft.solvent.pbe.bc_laplacian(solvent_obj, ngrids, spacing, T, phi_z, grad_phi_z, sas, grad_sas)#

Laplacian of the boundary values.

Parameters:

  • solvent_obj (PBE) – Solvent object.

  • ngrids (int) – Number of grid points along each axis.

  • spacing (float) – Grid spacing.

  • T (float) – Temperature.

  • phi_z (1D numpy.ndarray) – Boundary value before applying the solvent-accessible surface.

  • grad_phi_z (2D numpy.ndarray) – Gradient of the boundary values before applying the solvent accessible surface.

  • sas (1D numpy.ndarray) – Solvent-accessible surface.

  • grad_sas (2D numpy.ndarray) – Gradient of the solvent-accessible surface.

Returns:

Laplacian of the boundary values.

Return type:

1D numpy.ndarray

fcdft.solvent.pbe.gen_pbe_solver(solvent_obj, verbose=None)#
fcdft.solvent.pbe.get_rho_ions(solvent_obj, phi_tot=None, cb=None, lambda_r=None, T=None)#

Size-modified ion charge density.

Parameters:

  • solvent_obj (PBE) – Solvent object

  • phi_tot (1D numpy.ndarray, optional) – Total electrostatic potential. Defaults to None.

  • cb (float, optional) – Ion concentration in atomic unit. Defaults to None.

  • lambda_r (1D numpy.ndarray, optional) – Ion-exclusion function. Defaults to None.

  • T (float, optional) – Temperature. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Ion charge density

Return type:

1D numpy.ndarray

fcdft.solvent.pbe.impose_bc(solvent_obj, ngrids=None, spacing=None, bias=None, stern_sam=None, T=None, eps_sam=None, eps=None, sas=None, pzc=None, ref_pot=None, jump_coeff=None)#

Boundary condition generator by the linearized Poisson-Boltzmann equation and the Gouy-Chapman-Stern model.

Parameters:

  • solvent_obj (PBE) – Solvent object.

  • ngrids (int) – Number of grid points along each axis.

  • spacing (float) – Grid spacing.

  • bias (float) – Bias Potential.

  • stern (float) – Stern layer by self-assembled monolayer.

  • kappa (float) – Debye inverse screening length.

  • T (float) – Temperature.

  • eps_sam (float) – Dielectric constant of the self-assembled monolayer.

  • eps (float) – Dielectric constant of the bulk solvent.

Returns:

Boundary values, electrostatic potential before applying solvent-accessible surface, and the potential slope in the Stern layer.

Return type:

1D numpy.ndarray, 1D numpy.ndarray, float

fcdft.solvent.pbe.make_eps(solvent_obj, coords, eps_sam, eps, stern_sam, delta1, sas)#

Calculates the dielectric function.

Parameters:

  • coords (2D numpy.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinates

  • eps_sam (float) – Dielectric constant of the self-assembled monolayer

  • eps (float) – Dielectric constant of the bulk solvent.

  • stern_sam (float) – Stern layer length of the self-assembled monolayer in atomic unit.

  • delta1 (float) – Broadening constant of error functions.

  • sas (1D numpy.ndarray) – Solvent-accessible surface.

Returns:

Dielectric function

Return type:

1D numpy.ndarray

fcdft.solvent.pbe.make_grad_eps(solvent_obj, mol, coords, eps_sam, eps, probe, stern_sam, delta1, delta2, atomic_radii, sas)#

Generates analytic gradient of the dielectric function.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf.gto.Mole) – Mole object.

  • coords (2D numpy.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinates.

  • eps_sam (float) – Dielectric constant of the self-assembled monolayer.

  • eps (float) – Dielectric constant of the bulk solvent.

  • probe (float) – Probe radius.

  • stern_sam (float) – Thickness of the Stern layer formed by the self-assembled monolayer.

  • delta1 (float) – Width of error function along z-axis.

  • delta2 (float) – Width of error function used for molecular part.

  • atomic_radii (1D numpy.ndarray) – Atomic radii.

  • sas (1D numpy.ndarray) – Solvent-accessible surface.

Returns:

Gradient of the dielectric function.

Return type:

2D numpy.ndarray

fcdft.solvent.pbe.make_lambda(solvent_obj, mol, probe, stern_mol, stern_sam, coords, delta1, delta2, atomic_radii)#

Ion-exclusion function.

Parameters:

  • mol (pyscf.gto.Mole) – Mole object.

  • probe (float) – Probe radius in a.u..

  • stern_mol (float) – Molecular Stern layer thickness in a.u..

  • stern_sam (float) – SAM Stern layer thickness in a.u..

  • coords (2D numpy.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinates.

  • delta1 (float) – Broadening constant in error functions used for the molecular part.

  • delta2 (float) – Broadening constant in error functions used for the SAM part.

  • atomic_radii (1D numpy.ndarray) – Atomic radii

Returns:

Ion-exclusion function

Return type:

1D array

fcdft.solvent.pbe.make_phi(solvent_obj, bias=None, phi_sol=None, rho_sol=None)#

Non-linear Poisson-Boltzmann equation driver.

Parameters:

  • solvent_obj – An instance of PBE

  • bias (float, optional) – Bias potential in atomic unit. Defaults to None.

  • phi_sol (numpy.ndarray, optional) – Solute potential in vacuum. Defaults to None.

  • rho_sol (numpy.ndarray, optional) – Solute charge density in vacuum. Defaults to None.

Raises:

  • RuntimeError – Infinite ion charge density.

  • RuntimeError – PBE self-consistent cycle fails to converge.

Returns:

Total potential, ion charge density, and polarization charge density.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray

fcdft.solvent.pbe.make_phi_sol(solvent_obj, dm=None, coords=None)#

Generates solute potential in vacuum.

Parameters:

  • solvent_obj (PBE) – Solvent object.

  • dm (2D numpy.ndarray) – Density matrix

  • coords (2D numpy.ndarray) – Cartesian grids.

Returns:

Solute electrostatic potential.

Return type:

numpy tag_array

fcdft.solvent.pbe.make_rho_sol(solvent_obj, phi_sol=None, spacing=None)#

Solute charge density by solving the Poisson equation.

Parameters:

  • solvent_obj (PBE) – Solvent object.

  • phi_sol (1D numpy.ndarray) – Electrostatic potential of the solute molecule.

  • spacing (float) – Grid spacing

Returns:

Solute charge density

Return type:

1D numpy.ndarray

fcdft.solvent.pbe.pbe_for_scf(mf, solvent_obj=None, dm=None)#
fcdft.solvent.pbe.phi_a_finder(kappa, T, eps, eps_sam, stern_sam, bottom)#

Interface potential value finder by the bisection + Newton-Rhapson method.

Parameters:

  • kappa (float) – Debye inverse screening length in atomic unit.

  • T (float) – Temperature in Kelvin.

  • eps (float) – Dielectric constant of bulk solvent.

  • eps_sam (float) – Dielectric constant of the self-assembled monolayer.

  • stern_sam (float) – Stern layer length in atomic unit.

  • bottom (float) – Relative potential at the bottom in atomic unit.

Raises:

RuntimeError – Convergence failure in 1000 Newton-Raphson cycles.

Returns:

Electrostatic potential at the interface.

Return type:

float
